description: From cōnflāgrāt-, the perfect passive participial stem of the Latin cōnflāgrō (“I am consumed by fire”, “I set aflame”).

verbs.description: conflagrate (third-person singular simple present conflagrates, present participle conflagrating, simple past and past participle conflagrated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To catch fire. [17th century to the present]
(transitive) To set fire to something. [17th century to the present]
